result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M Melton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cost to be paid FORTHWITH.
In lieu of payment, defendant to serve an additional 5 days jail, concurrent to the 6 months.
DNA Sample and Surcharge Waived.

Court orders the Defendant to serve 6 months in jail, concurrent to Waukesha County case 08CF1221 (Revocation).
To be served in the State Prison System.
Defendant to be transferred to DCI.
Concurrent with: Case 08CF1221 (Revocation).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon M Melton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brandon M Melton in court, in custody, with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by Atty. Graber.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to Waukesha County Case:  08CF1221 (Revocation).
To be served in the State Prison System.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge: Court Waives
To be paid FORTHWITH - In Lieu of payment defendant to serve an additional 5 Days concurrent to the 6 Months.

Defendant to be transferred to DCI.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brandon M Melton in court, in custody, with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by atty. Graber.  
Court to address - Status of Revocation (Defendant stated he signed his revocation paperwork back in November of 2015).

Atty. Graber presented statements to the court.
Revocation paperwork did go through this month.
Court Orders the Defendant remain here pending his next court date.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brandon M Melton in court, in custody, with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by atty. Graber.
   
Defendant stated he signed his revocation paperwork back in November.
However, no order and warrant has been filed.

Defense received discovery in court.
  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brandon M Melton in court, in custody.  
Defendant signed his revocation paperwork back in November of 2015.
  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Brandon M Melton in court, in custody.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is in custody on a probation hold and indicates he will be transfered to Dodge.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
